snippet: Those who warned that Republicans backing gay marriage in New York would face consequences saw proof they were right.
abstract: Conservative Republicans in New York State point to tight election results as proof that State senators who supported New York's same-sex marriage law would face negative electoral consequences; Republican Senator Stephen M Saland of Poughkeepsie, after serving in the Legislature for 32 years and winning by 19 percentage points in 2010, clings to a 42-vote lead as absentee ballots are counted.
lead_paragraph: Those who warned that Republicans backing gay marriage in New York would face consequences saw proof they were right.

headline.seo: No Victors Yet in 2 G.O.P. Challenges to Backers of Marriage Bill
headline.main: Votes Aren’t All Tallied, but Conclusions Are Drawn
headline.print_headline: Votes Aren’t All Tallied, but Conclusions Are Drawn

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject
